item.title: Dumbblle Plots
item.description:
library(tidyverse)
## Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'tibble':
##   method     from  
##   format.tbl pillar
##   print.tbl  pillar
## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 --
## v ggplot2 3.3.2     v purrr   0.3.3
## v tibble  3.0.1     v dplyr   1.0.2
## v tidyr   1.0.2     v stringr 1.4.0
## v readr   1.3.1     v forcats 0.4.0
## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Warning: package 'tibble' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.6.3
## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() --
## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
## x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
library(ggalt)
## Warning: package 'ggalt' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt':
##   method                  from   
##   grid.draw.absoluteGrob  ggplot2
##   grobHeight.absoluteGrob ggplot2
##   grobWidth.absoluteGrob  ggplot2
##   grobX.absoluteGrob      ggplot2
##   grobY.absoluteGrob      ggplot2
library(ggthemes)
## Warning: package 'ggthemes' was built under R version 3.6.3
library(showtext)
## Warning: package 'showtext' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Loading required package: sysfonts
## Warning: package 'sysfonts' was built under R version 3.6.3
## Loading required package: showtextdb
## Warning: package 'showtextdb' was built under R version 3.6.3
font_add_google("Overpass", "Overpass")


theme_set(theme_tufte())
theme_update(
  text = element_text(family = 'Overpass'),
  plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10),
  plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#FEF9EA", color = "#FEF9EA"),
  strip.background = element_blank(),
  panel.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),

)
data <- read_csv('strategic_rivalries.csv')
## Parsed with column specification:
## cols(
##   rivalryno = col_double(),
##   rivalryname = col_character(),
##   sidea = col_character(),
##   sideb = col_character(),
##   styear = col_double(),
##   endyear = col_double(),
##   region = col_character(),
##   type1 = col_character(),
##   type2 = col_character(),
##   type3 = col_character()
## )
data
## Warning: `...` is not empty.
## 
## We detected these problematic arguments:
## * `needs_dots`
## 
## These dots only exist to allow future extensions and should be empty.
## Did you misspecify an argument?
## # A tibble: 197 x 10
##    rivalryno rivalryname   sidea  sideb  styear endyear region type1 type2 type3
##        <dbl> <chr>         <chr>  <chr>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>
##  1         1 Austria-Fran~ Austr~ France   1494    1918 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  2         2 Austria-Otto~ Austr~ Ottom~   1494    1908 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  3         4 France-Spain  France Spain    1494    1700 Europ~ posi~ spat~ <NA> 
##  4         3 Britain-Fran~ Great~ France   1494    1716 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  5         5 Ottoman Empi~ Ottom~ Spain    1494    1585 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  6         6 Ottoman Empi~ Ottom~ Venice   1494    1717 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  7         7 Portugal-Spa~ Portu~ Spain    1494    1580 Europ~ spat~ posi~ <NA> 
##  8         8 Portugal-Ven~ Portu~ Venice   1494    1580 Europ~ posi~ <NA>  <NA> 
##  9         9 Ottoman Empi~ Ottom~ Portu~   1501    1580 Europ~ posi~ <NA>  <NA> 
## 10        10 Britain-Spai~ Brita~ Spain    1568    1667 Europ~ posi~ spat~ <NA> 
## # ... with 187 more rows
data %>% 
  filter(region == 'European GPs') %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = styear,xend = endyear,y = rivalryname)) +
  geom_dumbbell() 
## Warning in grid.Call(C_stringMetric, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label)): font family not
## found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_stringMetric, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label)): font family not
## found in Windows font database
## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database
## Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
## font family not found in Windows font database

data %>% 
  filter(region == 'European GPs') %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = styear,xend = endyear,y = rivalryname)) +
  geom_dumbbell(color = 'gray70',
                size = 2,
                colour_x = '#e63946',
                colour_xend = '#118ab2',
                size_x = 4,
                size_xend = 4) 
## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database
## Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
## font family not found in Windows font database

The result is not quite what we want to see. It would be better if we can sort rivalires and show them based on their duration so the longer rivalries are placed on top.

data %>% 
  filter(region == 'European GPs') %>% 
  mutate(duration = endyear - styear ) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = styear,xend = endyear,y = fct_reorder(rivalryname,duration))) +
  geom_dumbbell(color = 'gray70',
                size = 2,
                colour_x = '#e63946',
                colour_xend = '#118ab2',
                size_x = 4,
                size_xend = 4) 
## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database

## Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
## family not found in Windows font database
## Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
## font family not found in Windows font database

library(plotly)
## Warning: package 'plotly' was built under R version 3.6.3
## 
## Attaching package: 'plotly'
## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':
## 
##     last_plot
## The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter
## The following object is masked from 'package:graphics':
## 
##     layout
data %>% 
    filter(region == 'European GPs') %>% 
  plot_ly(color = I("gray80"))%>%
  add_segments(x = ~styear,xend = ~endyear,y = ~rivalryname,yend = ~rivalryname)  %>% 
  add_markers(x = ~styear,y = ~rivalryname,color = I('#e63946')) %>%
  add_markers(x = ~endyear,y = ~rivalryname,color = I('#118ab2'))
## Warning: `arrange_()` was deprecated in dplyr 0.7.0.
## Please use `arrange()` instead.
## See vignette('programming') for more help
## Warning: `group_by_()` was deprecated in dplyr 0.7.0.
## Please use `group_by()` instead.
## See vignette('programming') for more help

with geom_dumbbell we can only plot two points. There are other tricks to create a multi-point dumbbell plots. Basically, we can use a combination of geom_segment() and geom_point() to do this.

https://www.r-bloggers.com/2019/06/make-multi-point-dumbbell-plots-in-ggplot2/ https://plotly.com/r/dumbbell-plots/

item.title: Tidy Tuesday Submissions
item.description:
For six years, I used python exclusively as the primary tool for carrying out my data science tasks and running my experiments. Recently, I have started using Tidyverse packages and tools in R for my data science activities. I am completely fascinated by how these tools make it easy for me to perform analysis and create nice visualization. Since then, I have tried to participate in the weekly Tidy Tuesday project. You can find my submissions on this page.

2020

Week 39 - Himalayan Peaks

Week 37 - Friends

Palmere Penguines

Week 12

Week 3

2019

Week 52 - Christmas Songs

Week 51 -Adoptable dogs

Week 46 - Code in CRAN Packages

Week 36 - Mooreâ€™s Law

Week 35 - Simpsons Guest Stars
